Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_mzkq45BSy91rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/42cde5c305bbc356348da80e6c18db4c/tumblr_inline_mzkqk7Lgde1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/9f5b149a870bced14532ecd91df480e2/tumblr_inline_mzkqlo0Tp31rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>Today marked the third anniversary of <strong>HarvesteR</strong> and*<span><strong>aLeXmOrA</strong></span>'s initial coding work on <em><strong>Kerbal Space Program</strong></em>. To celebrate, we wanted to send each of you a cake. Considering shipping costs and what would inevitably be an unmitigated disaster of culinary proportions by the time it got to you, we figured that these wonderfully made cakes submitted by <strong>Jodi</strong> and <strong>Ashley</strong> from Facebook would hit the spot.</p>
Why not just strap it on some boosters and give it a chute? Lol. Nice cakes Jodi and Ashley and happy anniversary!
Cool. Happy BD for the guys (and girl)! Could have used a mainsail cannon and add parachutes, though.
Happy Anniversary! I can't believe how far KSP has come in 3 years!
